author: @einsteinwallah2
text: *about quantopian*: is it possible to draw a sample of past dates and start *back testing* of a strategy against DJIA components that existed on those random dates? for example, if a random date falls in year 1949 then at that time DJIA had different component stocks and ideally we want to know if strategy would have worked in any situation at all ... problem with starting from a fixed date or even beginning of share's trading of a currently popular stock is that back at the time when it started trading we did not know it was going to be a great company ... we did not know apple was going to be a profitable when it was started ... so using DJIA components prevailing at a random time is more important than using currently popular stocks

author: @jimmac386
text: Hello, I just watched the IBPy video.  My father uses IB and has a good system but he is constantly letting emotion break him from the system but when followed the system does seem to work consistently making money.  I am A sysadmin but not a programmer beyond taking what others have done and making it work for my purposes.  I have full respect for the open source community.  Comfortable on Linux Mac and Windows.  I am joining my father in his endeavor and the first task is to find someone such as yourself to help us on the programming side.  An NDA would be needed for some aspects of the project.  We are willing to pay you a reasonable rate and offer some sort of profit sharing with no downside loss exposure to you.  The up front compensation should be calculated without consideration of profit sharing, in other words, if we never make any money you are still paid fairly.  Are you interested in anything like this or do you know of anyone good who might be?  The initial project would be to automate a manual trading strategy using the IB API.  If you are interested I will give you my email and we can discuss there but I would also like to talk to you by phone at some point.  Regardless of your decision, I join the chorus to thank you for all the hard work you have put into these tutorials. Jim

author: @nsimmons9427
text: You are a modern day prometheus and a robin hood of intellect!!! Your tutorials are the 21st century's answer to Diderot's encyclopedia. Thank you so much for these videos. There are many people, like myself, with interest in finance, computer science, and mathematics who are byproducts of public school defunding, systematic and compounded socioeconomic inequality, and overall scarce and extremely limited access to technical, financial, and mathematic bodies of knowledge--who for a myriad of reasons, would never have the opportunity to be exposed to these core concepts had you not took the time out to upload these videos. Universities charge multiples of thousands of dollars for what you're offering for free and most (from my research) don't even teach this at the undergrad level! You are a life savior and a hero! Your videos encapsulate the principle behind the parable of "teach a man to fish." Thanks to you, I have renewed hope in my aspirations of embarking on a career in finance and less fear of my educational disadvantages obstructing that goal. Sincerely, thank you for all of the hard work you put into these instructional videos and thank you so much for making them free to the public.
